main event: A civilian witness, less than 15 years old, spotted a multi-colored celestial object with a blinking, flickering pattern near Carlsbad, New Mexico in May 1964.
interesting points: The object was described as being similar in size to the planet Venus, with colors of green, red, and yellow.
The object exhibited a pulsing, cyclical pattern of colors, like an airport beacon, with yellow remaining a constant mid-color.
The object was observed for approximately 2 hours and 50 minutes, with a 30-minute disappearance around 50 minutes into the sighting.
The object was initially seen west of Carlsbad, at an elevation of 40 degrees, and was last seen below and to the left of the Big Dipper, just above the horizon.
Multiple civilian witnesses, including a 15-year-old and an air traffic control specialist, reported the sighting, but the air traffic controller did not observe anything unusual.
sighted object: multi-colored celestial object with blinking, flickering pattern
witnesses: civilian witnesses, including a 15-year-old and an air traffic control specialist
